etymology.description: Horse with head left, flowing mane -> head simplified to 目(目) (mù, "eye"); legs to 灬(灬) (huǒ, "four dots")
etymology.interpretation: The character 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse") pictorially represents a horse with a flowing mane and simplified features: the head as an eye and legs as dots. It clearly conveys the image of a horse.
etymology.simplification: 马(馬): simplified by adopting a cursive script form.

examples.chinese: 那匹马在草原上奔跑(那匹馬在草原上奔跑)。
examples.pinyin: Nà pǐ mǎ zài cǎoyuán shàng bēnpǎo.
examples.english: That horse runs on the grassland.

examples.chinese: 农夫牵着马(農夫牽着馬)，走向村庄(走向村莊)。
examples.english: The farmer leads the horse, walking towards the village.

examples.chinese: 小女孩骑着马(小女孩騎着馬)，在花园里玩耍(在花園里玩耍)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo nǚhái qízhe mǎ, zài huāyuán lǐ wánshuǎ.
examples.english: The little girl rides the horse, playing in the garden.
